BW \ backgrounds, while the Inverse theme is used on top of coloured

Media container
The Compact card can never be used without a media container. You can choose
between using an image or a video.
Image
The image container uses the Aspect Ratio Box component and
supports all the aspect ratios from it.
Current supported aspect ratios are:
1:1, 3:4, 4:3, 4:5, 6:7, 9:16 and 16:9.
New
/ he
~ Eyl o
The UTSADD pet collection >
The life of pets at home
Simple Video
The Simple Video player supports basic video playback with
autoplay and minimal controls. Clicking anywhere on the video
will toggle between play and pause. Users can also click on the
controls of the video to toggle between the two actions.
ALAN

The life of pets at home
Entry points to detailed information
Cards serve as previews and signposts to more detailed information. Keep them short
and easy to read, providing just enough information to encourage users to explore
further on the linked page.

A gallery of Compact Cards functioning as entry points to other pages.
Card content
Compact Cards are used as entry points to other pages. Text will overflow to multiple
lines, make them clear and concise. Read more about our writing principles in this
guide.

(] A simple, bite-sized title, communicating the card's link destination. (1) Avoid using the card's title to overwhelm the user with information that could be
communicated on the linked page.
Image content in cards
Cards are designed for inspirational images. Avoid using isolated or solitary product
images, as they may appear disconnected from the accompanying text. Additionally,
product images tend to have very narrow white margins. Products should always be
displayed with a price and product information.
You can find more information about presentation techniques for the range on the Visa
Digital Retail Experience Hub.

(] Use inspirational images. (1) Don't use isolated product images in cards.
Consistent image aspect ratios
When displaying multiple Compact Cards in a row or grid, for visual consistency, the
images should all be displayed with the same image aspect ratio.

Behaviours
Responsive vs. fixed cards
Responsive cards are designed to adapt their layout depending on the viewport width.
Small Medium
0-599 px 600 px-

Responsive cards’ typography change across breakpoints.
Fixed cards are designed to be used in groups, where you nest cards into grid columns,
carousels or bento layouts. Their layout and typography remain constant and
predictable as they ignore context.

Fixed cards’ typography remain constant across breakpoints.
Hit areas
The entire card acts as an interactive area. Tapping anywhere on the card takes the user
to the card's destination. If the media container contains a video, the hit areas are
divided. Do not set individual exit links on the media container and the content surface
since it will be unclear for the user where the links lead.
